channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Woman, 29, abandoned a toddler for six hours while she visited her boyfriend in Pentonville prison
item.description: Ebtissam Yahya, 29, one count of child neglect at Westminster Magistrates' Court today after she abandoned a toddler for six hours while visiting her boyfriend at Pentonville prison.

item.title: Jonathan Ross's daughter Honey slams diets suggested by parents
item.description: Making an appearance on Tuesday's edition of Loose Women, the writer and activist, 23, said she found the incident 'absolutely toxic', and encouraged parents not to do what hers did with their children.

item.title: Coronavirus: London man stranded on Samoan island til Christmas
item.description: Back in March, Rob Small, from London, was enjoying his time on the white sand and palm-fringed shores of Upolu in Samoa. But when coronavirus started to spread, all international travel was banned.

item.title: Harry Maguire found GUILTY and dropped from England squad
item.description: England defender and Manchester United captain Harry Maguire was today convicted of all charges after a brawl at the Greek holiday island of Mykonos.

item.title: Woman fired by literary agency over 'anti-trans' comments on Twitter
item.description: Sasha White, from New York, told her 8,000 followers on Monday that she'd been dismissed from her role as a literary agent assistant after she retweeted controversial comments.

item.title: Belarus jails two prominent activists
item.description: Olga Kovalkova and Siarhei Dyleuski were brought before separate courts and jailed as protests continued against the 26-year rule of President Alexander Lukashenko.

item.title: Jacob Blake is paralyzed from the waist down, his father says
item.description: Jacob Blake, the black man shot in the back by Wisonsin police as his three young sons watched on, is now paralyzed from the waist down after his body was riddled with bullets, his father says.

item.title: Free London Dungeon entry to people with SERIAL KILLER names
item.description: People unfortunate enough to share a name with the likes of Rose West or Harold Shipman will be able to visit the popular attraction in the UK's capital for free this week.

item.title: 300lb Colorado woman reveals how she lost HALF body weight
item.description: Michaela Miller, from Colorado, struggled with weight from an early age - but it spiraled out of control after her dad made cruel comments about her body.

item.title: Burial ground containing 350 people in tiny circular graves is unearthed in Japan
item.description: The site - dubbed the 'Umeda Tomb' - is located in Osaka and is thought to be one of seven historical grave sites located across the city.

item.title: Storm Francis pummels the UK overnight as the nation braces for more chaos today
item.description: Storm Francis brought gusts of more than 50mph overnight ahead of expected 70mph speeds this morning and a month's worth of rainfall in a few hours, causing chaos for commuters and tourists.

item.title: Nottingham teenagers jailed a total of 20 years for boy's murder
item.description: Ezekiel Clarke was killed in February when he was stabbed several times in the arm, chest, heart, liver and lung during an attack on a street in Nottingham.

item.title: Canadian woman, 44, is mauled to death by black bear outside family cabin
item.description: Stephanie Blais, 44, was on the phone with her dad when the bear attacked on Thursday outside the cabin at Mckie Lake, near Buffalo Falls.

item.title: North Yorks Police warn over drugs-laced 'Nerds Rope sweets'
item.description: North Yorkshire Police said parents and carers should be 'aware' of a rise in youths found with 'edibles' disguised as Nerds candy.

item.title: Man arrested on suspicion of murder after body found at tip
item.description: The freezer was moved from a flat in Birmingham to a waste management centre by a housing association before the body was discovered.

item.title: Julian Assange's partner says he is in 'a lot of pain'
item.description: Stella Moris took the couple's two children Gabriel, three, and Max, one, to visit their father at the south-east London prison for the first time since March 22.

item.title: Grandson of man who killed his wife in 1985 says he should never be released from prison
item.description: Russell Causley killed his wife Carole Packman 35 years ago and now he is facing a parole hearing, but his grandson says that he should never be released from prison.

item.title: Drunk chef, 22, died of 'catastrophic' head injuries after falling from railway platform onto tracks
item.description: Carrie Bremridge, from Merstham in Surrey, had been drinking with friends at a pub and attended a house party in January. She stumbled and fell onto the tracks at Redhill station, Surrey.

item.title: BBC director said he didn't want to turn Proms into a 'political platform'
item.description: David Pickard became director of the BBC Proms in 2015. Upon his appointment, he said he wanted to bring 'world-class classical music to the widest possible audience'.

item.title: Eat Out to Help out diners have claimed more than 64 million meals throughout August
item.description: The Treasury said this represents a continued 'upward trend' in dining, after 10.5 million meals were claimed in the first week, before climbing to a total of 35 million for the first two weeks.

item.title: BBC Songs of Praise producer compares Rule Britannia to Nazis singing about gas chambers
item.description: Cat Lewis, a self-described 'campaigner for a better world', has blasted the centuries-old anthem, which is traditionally performed at London's Royal Albert Hall every year.

item.title: Manchester United stand by Harry Maguire after 21-month suspended sentence was handed to him
item.description: Manchester United have revealed Harry Maguire will appeal against the guilty verdict handed to him for attacking and bribing Greek police and they have called for a 'full and fair' hearing.

item.title: Fitbit unveils new smartwatch called Sense that measures stress levels
item.description: Fitbit unveiled a new smartwatch capable of determining the wearer's stress levels by monitoring heart rate and skin temperature. Called Sense, it ships in Sept for $329.95.

item.title: Floating Apple Store next to Singapore's Marina Bay Sands Hotel
item.description: Apple is set to open its first floating Apple Store, a massive silver orb located near Singapore's Marina Bay Sands Hotel. It will gently glow at night, a nod to the paper lanterns used in local fall festivals.

item.title: BBC under fire from all sides for gagging Britannia
item.description: The BBC was today lambasted over its bungled decision to play Land of Hope and Glory and Rule Britannia without lyrics at the last Night of the Proms following a racism row, with TV bosses accused of 'erasing history' and caving in to 'woke morons'.

item.title: Four men who blasted compressed air into a friend's RECTUM are jailed
item.description: The victim had passed out at a party in Norway in 2018 and was unable to defend himself when five fellow revellers came up with the scheme to blast air into his rectum with an air compressor.

item.title: HMS Hermes - Britain's flagship during the Falklands - is sold for scrap
item.description: The HMS Hermes served as Britain's flagship in the Falklands before being sold to India in 1986 and renamed the INS Viraat, was decommissioned in 2017 and has now been sold for scrap.

item.title: George W. Bush will NOT endorse Joe Biden, his spokesman says
item.description: Former President George W. Bush will not explicitly endorse Joe Biden despite a number of more traditional Republicans crossing the aisle to back the Democrat in recent days.

item.title: Man charged with murder after he bashed the head of American mother-of-two, removed all her teeth
item.description: On Monday, the Tamaulipas, Mexico, state prosecutor charged Braulio Martínez with the murder of Lizbeth Flores, a 23-year-old mother-of-two from Brownsville, Texas.

item.title: Nottingham woman, 75, is the earliest known Covid-19 patient to catch the disease in the UK
item.description: Researchers from the University of Nottingham say the woman, who later became one of the first three people to die of the disease, may have caught it as early as February 9.

item.title: Britain's retail jobs bloodbath saw workers axed at the fastest pace since 2009
item.description: A survey by the Confederation of British Industry found that the number of retailers laying off and hiring staff over the past 12 months dropped to minus 45 per cent in August.

item.title: Elton John's wife Renate Blauel 'took overdose three days into honeymoon'
item.description: EXCLUSIVE; The German recording engineer, married to Sir Elton from 1984 to 1988, claimed she took an overdose of Valium tablets after he told her he wanted her to leave the honeymoon and go home.

item.title: Elon Musk's brain chip Neuralink is plagued by turmoil and rushed timelines former employees claim
item.description: Elon Musk's brain chip firm Neuralink will 'show neurons firing in real-time' Aug 28, but former employees claim the progress is a result of rushed timelines and a toxic work environment.

item.title: Ofqual chief regulator Sally Collier QUITS in wake of A-Level and GCSE grades chaos
item.description: Ms Collier, a career civil servant, had come in for criticism over the chaos that enveloped exam results for thousands of teenagers unable to sit tests because of coronavirus.

item.title: Melania Trump's closest aide says she has never heard First Lady trash her husband and Ivanka
item.description: Melania Trump's closet aide said she's never heard the first lady make any disparaging remarks about President Donald Trump or the first family after a report that there are tapes of Melania doing so.

item.title: Welsh newsreader Sian Williams reveals she's been training as a trauma counsellor
item.description: Channel 5 newsreader Sian Williams, 55, told The Telegraph that she will start a new job as a psychological therapist with the NHS in September.

item.title: Harry Maguire flies back to face the music following Mykonos brawl
item.description: The £190,000-a-week defender flew back to Britain on Sunday after spending two nights in a cell on the Greek party island of Mykonos.

item.title: Harry Maguire's girlfriend accuses Greek police of 'lying' and trying to 'ruin his reputation'
item.description: Fern Hawkins took to Twitter to rubbish accusations against her boyfriend Harry Maguire, 27, for an alleged bar brawl on the holiday island of Mykonos.

item.title: Fury as topless sunbathers are told to cover up their breasts by French police
item.description: Two gendarmes in the south of France sparked a public outcry after asking women who were sunbathing topless to get dressed, prompting politicians to call it 'a threat to our way of life'

item.title: Trump aide claims British baby Charlie Gard died because it was 'too expensive to keep him alive'
item.description: Natalie Harp, who has battled bone cancer, claimed in Washington last night that Britain's National Health Service decided it was 'too expensive and too cruel to keep him alive.'

item.title: Channel 4 will host 'Black Takeover Day' in 2021 as Big Breakfast returns for one-off special
item.description: From breakfast until late night, Channel 4 will disrupt its regular schedule and reimagine some of its biggest shows while also introducing new programmes led by black talent.

item.title: Nuneaton motorist spared jail after injuring driver when he deliberately crashed into a bridge
item.description: Christopher Farmer, 33, was charged with dangerous driving after he bounced his Mitsubishi Colt off a wall into the path of a vehicle being driven by Paul Swatman in Arley, Worcestershire.

item.title: Portugal pet hotel and Santorini cave complex among those vying for prestigious architecture prize
item.description: These hotels, from around the world, have all been longlisted in the hospitality architecture category in the prestigious Dezeen Awards 2020 - and they are all head-turners.

item.title: Judge blasts £21,000-a-year boarding school for giving a reference to paedophile housemaster
item.description: Paul Stevens (pictured), 62, got a job in Kenya after a reference from Abberley Hall School in Worcestershire. He had already abused boys at the school and abused others in Africa.

item.title: Coronavirus UK: New school rules put pupils in age 'bubbles'
item.description: The UK's Chief Medical Officers all agree that it is safe for children to go back, but headteachers will have to take a raft of precautions to prevent any outbreaks and stamp them out if they occur.

item.title: Covid-19 quarantine rules to Tui refunds - the Holiday Guru solves traveller queries
item.description: The Holiday Guru is always on hand to answer your questions. And with the pandemic causing mass confusion among travellers, the Guru's advice has never been more sought after.

item.title: Mother launches legal bid to stop her transgender daughter's frozen sperm being destroyed
item.description: Louise Anderson, 45, plans to go to the highest court in Scotland after learning that samples saved by her 16-year-old daughter Ellie, who died suddenly in July, could be thrown out in days.

item.title: Step-father's cancer turns terminal after his life-saving liver surgery was cancelled due to Covid
item.description: Adrian Rogers, 46, from Retford, Nottinghamshire, had surgery scheduled for early April. But doctors decided it was 'too risky'. He has now been told his cancer is terminal - meaning it can't be cured.

item.title: First picture of mother-of-three, 29, and father-of-two, 37, who died during Storm Ellen
item.description: Mother-of-three Tanya Jackson, 29, and Brett Rogers, a 37-year-old dad-of-two, were travelling through Derbyshire when their car skidded off the road and smashed into a tree on Saturday.

item.title: The families who dig up their dead relatives
item.description: Every August the Torja community in Panggala, Nort Toraja, South Sulawesi, re-dress their relatives' bodies, clean them, speak with them and even light them cigarettes.

item.title: EIGHT Met Police officers are now being probed for misconduct
item.description: Nicole Smallman, 26, and her half-sister Bibaa Henry, 47, were found dead in Fryent Country Park in Wembley, north west London , in June - two days after they were reported missing.

item.title: Ex-Renault Formula One boss Flavio Briatore, 70, is rushed to hospital
item.description: Flavio Briatore, 70, has complained over the past month about the Italian government's decision to close nightclubs are numbers of positive coronavirus cases in the country began to rise.

item.title: More people are dying than expected in England and Wales for first time in two months
item.description: Data from the Office for National Statistics showed that the number of people dying of Covid-19 each week has been falling constantly since April.

item.title: Save the Last Night of the Proms: Sign MailOnline's petition
item.description: The MailOnline is calling on readers to urge the BBC to reverse its censorship of Land of Hope and Glory and Rule Britannia at the Last Night of the Proms.

item.title: Girl, five, dies while waiting for a heart transplant after being diagnosed with rare condition
item.description: The devastated family of Thalia-Beau Wright, who was diagnosed with restrictive cardiomyopathy in 2018, announced yesterday that the youngster had succumbed to the rare illness.

item.title: British Airways long-haul flight attendant admits she DREADS work since the pandemic
item.description: The senior cabin crew member for BA, identified only as Alex, who flies out of London Heathrow, spoke to The Points Guys about the changes to long haul flying since the outbreak of coronavirus.

item.title: 11-month-old boy is slapped by his nanny who 'became resentful after she was scolded by the parents'
item.description: Security camera footage shows the woman spoon-feeding the infant before suddenly hitting the child's face multiple times. She was punished by police in north-eastern Chinese province Heilongjiang.

item.title: Should you help out when visiting your partner's house?
item.description: A British woman asked Mumsnet for advice after her 'controlling' boyfriend asked her to empty the bin, pass him items and clean the sofa, while she was visiting his house at the weekend.

item.title: Google's UK boss insists tech giant will 'always pay tax it is required to'
item.description: Managing director Ronan Harris made the pledge on ITV's Good Morning Britain today after MPs previously described the company's tax payment as 'insulting when other businesses are struggling'.

item.title: Lady Frederick Windsor says Princess Beatrice 'looked exquisite on her wedding day'
item.description: Sophie Winkleman, 40, who is married to Lord Frederick Windsor, 41, the son of the Queen's first cousin, Prince Michael of Kent, branded Princess Beatrice a 'heavenly girl' when speaking to Hello.

item.title: 'Nonsense': Boris Johnson rubbishes claim he is planning to QUIT as PM in six months
item.description: Sir Humphrey Wakefield, whose journalist daughter Mary is married to Dominic Cummings, is said to have made the claim to a holidaymaker who visited his castle in Northumberland.
item.media:credit: Jenney Goodall/ Wimbledon Village Stabes www.wvstables.com

item.title: Mysterious radio burst repeating every 157 days just 'woke up' right on schedule
item.description: A team from the University of Manchester predicted the Fast Radio Burst FRB 121102 would 'turn on' again by the end of August - which was proved to be correct by Chinese astronomers.

item.title: Laurence Fox urges Britons to buy Vera Lynn's Land of Hope and Glory
item.description: Tweeting a version by the British national treasure, Fox wrote: 'Wouldn't it be great if we could all come together to get Dame Vera Lynn's version of "Land of Hope and Glory" number one in the charts?'

item.title: Talita von Furstenberg admits she NEVER discusses her designs with DVF as she models her new range
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Talita Von Furstenberg, 21, who is currently residing in Malibu with her parents after an idyllic European break, is at the helm of a diffusion line - TVF for DVF - which is now in its third season.

item.title: Historic Appledore Shipyard where vessels have been built for 150 years is set to reopen
item.description: Appledore Shipyard in Devon is set to reopen, resuming more than 150 years of shipbuilding history that has seen the creation of aircraft carriers, super yachts and ferries.

item.title: St Michael clothes fetching hundreds on eBay as young shoppers seek nostalgic treasures
item.description: Young British fashionistas are snapping up vintage bargains online from Marks & Spencer's former label St Michael, which was discontinued in 2000, with experts crediting the label for its high quality.

item.title: Healthy pregnant women are not more vulnerable to Covid-19 and do not fall more seriously ill
item.description: Researchers looked at a total of 1.7million women from the UK, US and Sweden, 56,000 of whom were pregnant, finding no differences in the rate of infection or hospitalisation with Covid-19.

item.title: Fascinating historical graffiti found carved into New Forest trees
item.description: More than 100 examples of ancient graffiti carved into trees at the New Forest in Hampshire have been logged into a database by the New Forest National Park Authority.

item.title: British backpacker is left with flesh hanging from his leg after a SPIDER BITE in Cambodia
item.description: British backpacker Andrew Hodges, 56, was working in restaurants in Cambodia when he was bitten by a spider, which caused the flesh on his leg to peel off and the limb to swell to twice its size (right).

item.title: Facebook hiring 'attempts to influence UK Government policy'
item.description: The social media giant has reportedly used its financial clout to poach 10 former officials who worked on online regulation in recent months.

item.title: Neighbour vandalises £80,000 Porsche after blaming driver for 'splashing' his dog
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: A vindictive neighbour was caught on camera scratching a new £80,000 Porsche last Thursday after blaming the driver for 'splashing' his dog in Richmond, Surrey.

item.title: Black Lives Matter protester forced to remove posters because they looked like planning applications
item.description: Tsara Smith, 38, has been ordered by Mid Devon District Council to take down 30 anti-racism posters in a 100 mile radius as they look too much like planning documents.

item.title: The Yorkshire Job Centre: Single mother-of-three shocks viewers after gaining £450 in benefits week
item.description: Single mother-of-three Katrina, 24, from Leeds, appeared on Channel 4's The Yorkshire Job Centre last night as she prepared to take the Habitual Residence Test to claim benefits.

item.title: Victims of Christchurch mosque attack share heartbreak at gunman's sentencing hearing in New Zealand
item.description: Brenton Tarrant, the Australian man who killed 51 worshippers in New Zealand's worst modern-day mass shooting last year, is being sentenced this week after admitting to the gruesome crime.

item.title: Now Jeremy Corbyn's wife Laura Alvarez promises book that 'tells the actual truth'
item.description: Mr Corbyn's third wife, Mexican national Laura Alvarez, 51, made the announcement to her 16,600 Twitter followers on Sunday.

item.title: Chinese man drags a stray dog by its neck with a rope while riding on a motorbike
item.description: Horrifying footage shows the motorcyclist pulling the small pooch along a road in Fujian province as the animal was helplessly moving its paws, trying to escape. The dog has been treated at a vet clinic.

item.title: Lewis Burton enjoys Ibiza after Caroline Flack's mother's attack
item.description: The former tennis player, 28, put on an extremely amorous display with the bikini-clad beauty as they enjoyed the final days of their sunny getaway, hours after another tense exchange.

item.title: Blood transfusions could protect stroke patients from brain damage, mouse trial shows
item.description: Researchers from the US found that mice given induced strokes had reduced symptoms after being given an injection of blood from a healthy peer.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE: FBI drug informant 'White Boy Rick' interviewed
item.description: Richard Wershe Jr 'White Boy Rick', 51, has broken his silence for the first time since becoming a free man in July. He told DailyMail.com he 'harbors no anger' after being imprisoned for 32 years.

item.title: Kremlin dismisses claims that Putin was behind Alexei Navalny's 'poisoning'
item.description: Friends of Alexei Navalny (pictured) have pointed the finger at Putin after the opposition leader fell ill on a flight in Siberia and was airlifted to Berlin in a critical condition.

item.title: Big Fat Gypsy Wedding star Paddy Doherty's son is left with a 'bleed on the brain'
item.description: The Celebrity Big Brother winner said the gang managed to take his son's watch but couldn't get the diamond ring off his finger because it had swollen. The attack took place in Llangefni, Anglesey.

item.title: Army's iconic bearskin hats worn by the Queen's Guard are under threat
item.description: New plans could see the elimination of bearskins worn by the British Foot Guards - made with fur from the Canadian black bear.

item.title: Canary Islands:Illegal immigrant arrivals 600% higher than 2019
item.description: Illegal migration to the chain of volcanic islands in the Atlantic Ocean, has risen over six-fold this year compared to the same time last year, to 3,448 people as of August 16.

item.title: Nurse, 33, is fined £150 for 'fly-tipping' after leaving free apples outside her home for passers-by
item.description: Lydia Farrell said she was 'disheartened' that a council would fine someone doing a good deed. Ealing Council, in west London, has said it will withdraw the fine following backlash.

item.title: Cat returns home with note on its collar from local Toby Carvery
item.description: Posting on Facebook, Nicole Clark, 41, told how she was shocked and amused to discover her Siberian feline, Tula, had been indulging in scraps from the Toby Carvery in Abbey Meads, Swindon.

item.title: Crash survivor's eulogy at funeral of her husband and children
item.description: Geraldine Mullan, 45, lost her husband John Mullan, 49, and children Tomas, 14, and Amelia, six, when their car plunged off the road into Lough Foyle in Donegal, Ireland, last week.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's biographer comments on Prince Andrew's 'horrendous mess'
item.description: Omid Scobie, who co-authored Prince Harry, 35, and Meghan Markle's explosive biography Finding Freedom, called critics of the Duchess of Sussex 'morons' in the scathing tweet.

item.title: Coronavirus: New powers to close Birmingham bars and restaurants which flout rules
item.description: Birmingham City Council has announced that as of Wednesday it will have the ability to investigate reports of premises failing to adhere to Covid-19 guidance.

item.title: Police launch urgent appeal for missing 14-year-old girl who disappeared after leaving McDonald's
item.description: Ruby Lever was last seen at McDonald's on Liscard Way in Wallasey, near Liverpool, at about 8pm on Monday. She is described as 5ft 2in tall, of slim build and with long brown hair with blonde highlights.

item.title: A seal of approval! Amazing moment curious seal nicknamed 'Gavin' climbs onto a paddle board
item.description: A group of paddle boarders were paid a surprise visit by 'Gavin' the seal, as he hitched a ride on the back of their boards along the River Arun, near Littlehampton in West Sussex.

item.title: Study to find out whether mouthwash can reduce spread of Covid-19
item.description: Covid-19 patients at the University Hospital of Wales in Cardiff will take part in new research to find out if it has the potential to reduce the levels of the virus in saliva.

item.title: Catalytic converter thefts from parked cars rose 600% in 2019
item.description: Thefts of catalytic converters from the underside of cars in 2019 rose to 13,000 reported cases in England and Wales - up from 2,000 the year previous, according to a new investigation.

item.title: Deaf and mute girl, 14, is gang-raped and murdered
item.description: A child was playing in Uttrita Middle School's playground in Khirundha when he found the body of the disabled girl who had gone missing the night before. Hundreds of villagers were outraged.

item.title: Boy, five, dies after being hit by van in Newcastle as police arrest man, 38
item.description: Layton Darwood died after he was struck by a Ford Transit van on Willow Avenue in Fenham, Newcastle, at 4.50pm yesterday. The boy was rushed to hospital but was later pronounced dead.

item.title: Judy Garland's former Hollywood Hills home where daughter Liza Minnelli was born is sold for $4.7M
item.description: The 5,000 square feet Art Deco home overlooks Los Angeles' Sunset Strip and was built in 1941 by John Elgin Woolf, an architect known for designing homes for celebs including Cary Grant and Bob Hope.

item.title: 'Clever' Palace is bringing Kate Middleton 'into the forefront' as a 'Queen-in-waiting'
item.description: Kate Middleton, who is currently staying with her family at Anmer Hall in Norfolk, is taking on more duties, royal expert Katie Nicholl told True Royalty's Kate: The Making of a Modern Queen.

item.title: Raheem Sterling tests NEGATIVE for coronavirus and 'is feeling fine'
item.description: Raheem Sterling has tested negative for coronavirus after attending Usain Bolt's birthday party, with the Olympic legend having tested positive for the illness.

item.title: Drug giant AstraZeneca starts trial of Covid-19 antibody injections
item.description: Cambridge-based AstraZeneca has begun human trials of its monoclonal antibody therapy which works by injecting people with immune molecules taken from Covid-19 patients.

item.title: Dutch and Belgian patients re-infected with Covid-19 after recovery
item.description: The cases - reported by local media - follow yesterday's landmark report of a Hong Kong man who was re-infected four and a half months after he was originally struck down.

item.title: Tom Cruise looks every inch the action star as he lands a helicopter in London
item.description: The film star, 58, looked cool and in control as he landed his helicopter at Battersea Heliport on Monday.

item.title: 'I can't see my notes anymore': Match of the Day host Gary Lineker says his eyesight is worsening
item.description: The 59-year-old presenter revealed his eyesight is getting worse and that he struggles to read his large notes and even see other pundits while on air with Match of the Day or BT Sport.

item.title: UK workers are the MOST reluctant to return to the office because of second wave fears, says study
item.description: A survey of 8,000 adults from eight countries found that UK and US workers showed the highest level of apathy towards going back to the office.

item.title: Doctors to trial treatment for Covid-19 patients with diabetes
item.description: British firm Excalibur Healthcare Services will trial the AstraZeneca-made medication AZD1656 to see if it can reduce serious illness or death among Covid-19 patients with diabetes.

item.title: University Challenge contestant with a 'thousand yard stare' destroys rival team
item.description: Oxford History student Seoan Webb has been dubbed star of the new series of University Challenge after he blew his peers out of the water in the match against Bristol University.

item.title: Mom of Detroit woman, 20, wrongly declared dead by paramedics is 'devastated' by daughter's ordeal
item.description: 'I'm devastated that my daughter is going through what she's going through,' 20-year-old Timesha Beauchamp's mother said, adding that the Michigan woman might not survive her ordeal.

item.title: Pictured: British man, 55, is plucked from the sea while fully dressed on surfboard near Marbella
item.description: This is the moment (pictured) a 'British' man who claims to have spent three days at sea on a surfboard after falling off a cruise ship, was plucked from the water.

item.title: How Peter Foster allegedly duped a Hong Kong punter out of $1.89million - as conman fronts court
item.description: The convicted conman was dramatically arrested by undercover police last Thursday, accused of orchestrating a multi-million dollar sports betting scam.

item.title: Nora Quoirin inquest is told police searched multiple houses during hunt
item.description: Senior police official Mohamad Nor Marzukee Besar told a court in Seremban city today that the family identified three houses where they thought the child might be held.

item.title: White Island volcano survivor who lost her family shares her gratitude for her doctors and nurses
item.description: The 24-year-old has spent the past eight months recovery, finally returning home in May after ongoing treatment and rehabilitation at the Alfred Hospital in Melbourne.

item.title: Dead calf is found with its ear hacked off after attack in France
item.description: WARNING - GRAPHIC CONTENT: The calf was found dead with lacerations on its genitals after an assault on Friday night, while a horse had its throat cut in Eure-et-Loir (pictured).

item.title: Police officer sacked after offering to have sex in his patrol car with woman he met on dating app
item.description: PC Andy Ross, 42, who worked for Wilshire Police, was dismissed from the force after an inquiry heard that he met with a woman he spotted on a dating app while he was on uniformed duty.

item.title: Mother of photographer's autistic son, 10, 'gave boy a sleeping drug'
item.description: Dylan Freeman's body was discovered at the family's home in Acton, West London, on August 16. His mother, Russian national Olga Freeman, was charged with murder and remanded in custody.

item.title: Ugandan refugee mother in her 30s is found dead beside malnourished baby in Glasgow flat
item.description: Ugandan mother Mercy Baguma, in her 30s, was found by police at a flat in Govan in Glasgow on Saturday, after friends, who had not seen her since Tuesday, raised the alarm.

item.title: All 900 workers at Scottish chicken factory at centre of covid outbreak are ordered to self-isolate
item.description: Management at the 2 Sisters plant, in Coupar Angus, issued the ultimatum as the number of positive coronavirus cases linked to the factory rose to 152, including 134 employees.

item.title: Jo Frost breaks down in tears as she speaks about her deathly food allergy in Supernanny USA
item.description: Supernanny USA viewers praised Jo Frost for helping parents Dan and Miranda Andersen cope with their anxiety surrounding their children's life-threatening food allergies.

item.title: William Hague says UK needs Joe Biden to win US presidential election
item.description: William Hague today said a Joe Biden victory at the US presidential election 'would be good for Britain' as he accused Donald Trump of showing 'disdain for the values of freedom and democracy'.

item.title: Mansion linked to Spain's King Juan Carlos is plagued by 'incidents'
item.description: Lawyers for Corinna Larsen, the former mistress of King Juan Carlos I and the owner of the Chyknell Hall Estate in Shropshire, spoke of 'a number of incidents' at the estate.

item.title: Young couple raffle off £750,000 two-bedroom Victorian townhouse in London for just £2 a ticket
item.description: Lucy Mieville, 35, and husband James, decided they wanted more space following the recent birth of their baby daughter, and decided to raffle their home in Denmark Hill, south London.

item.title: Alfie Boe 'dated woman while married and dedicated song to wife as shocked lover sat in audience'
item.description: According to The Sun , the West End star, 46, started exchanging messages with the woman, who is said to be a broadcaster 16 years his junior, from December 2018 for five months.

item.title: Police launch urgent appeal to find missing 16-year-old girl who disappeared two days ago
item.description: Alesha White, 16, was last seen on Sunday in Luton, Bedfordshire. She was reported missing on Monday evening and police have launched a desperate bid to find her.

item.title: Survey finds hybrids cars are more reliable than petrol and diesel models
item.description: For many drivers, the next car they buy will be the last petrol or diesel-powered model before the sale of internal combustion engine vehicles are banned in 2035. Hybrids are most likely to last the decade.

item.title: Bloodthirsty seagull swoops down and steals helpless duckling
item.description: Amateur photographer Peter Christian captured the battle for the baby bird in Langness, a peninsula near the Isle of Man. The mother tried to fight the seagull off but the hunter flew off with the duckling.

item.title: A Suitable Boy viewers divided by Lata's choice in husband in the BBC series finale
item.description: WARNING: SPOILER ALERT. The BBC series followed the fortunes of a young girl called Lata Mehra, who attempted to find a suitable boy to marry in post-colonial India.

item.title: Eilat gang-rape: Israeli police say attack 'went on for hours' as two more are arrested
item.description: Police investigating the alleged gang-rape of a 16-year-old girl in Israel arrested two more minors on Monday and released another without charge, meaning the number of suspects stands at 12.

item.title: Ex-model claims friend slept with Prince Andrew on Jeffrey Epstein's orders
item.description: Former model Lisa Phillips's claims are set be broadcast in a new four-part documentary Surviving Jeffrey Epstein on the digital channel Crime+Investigation, which begins in the UK tonight.

item.title: Down's syndrome tot fronts campaign for children's store JoJo Maman Bébé
item.description: Helen Manton, 36, from Leamington Spa, said she 'jumped for joy' when she got the email from the popular childrenswear store asking her daughter, two, to front their latest campaign.

item.title: Bride reveals how she planned her intimate coronavirus wedding in just FOUR weeks
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Lauren Naylor, 39, from Essex, had her dream wedding cancelled - but after she and her groom suffered from coronavirus, she was determined to have her nuptials this month.

item.title: BTEC students will begin receiving their revised marks from today
item.description: Grading for BTECs was delayed to give exam board Pearson more time to recalculate the grades after A-level and GCSE results switched to teacher estimates marks.

item.title: Tricky trivia quiz challenges your general knowledge with 15 multiple choice questions
item.description: A fun new quiz from US-trivia site Playbuzz challenges your knowledge on a range of subjects from science to literature - and many have struggled to achieve a perfect score.

item.title: Experts explains how piling on the pounds can affect your vaginal health, libido and fertility
item.description: Experts from across the UK have revealed how a woman's weight could be having a devastating impact on her intimate areas and sex life, causing health issues like thrush and hormonal imbalances.

item.title: MARTIN SAMUEL: Harry Maguire only loses if he doesn't realise every day at Man United is a win
item.description: MARTIN SAMUEL - CHIEF SPORTS WRITER: Harry Maguire is in trouble for one simple reason: he does not know when he has won. Going to Mykonos was a bad call from the very start.

item.title: 6 easy ways to make your garden gorgeous in time for the bank holiday
item.description: We can't quite believe it but we are actually nearing the end of August. How did this happen?

item.title: One of a kind sustainable houseboat located in Regents Canal, London, on the market for £149,950
item.description: A luxurious two bedroom houseboat in London, one of the world's first to be made of sustainable steel, is up for sale for £149,950, featuring a utility room, open plan living space and a modern bathroom.

item.title: That'll teach them! Hilarious photos reveal animals whose greed got the better of them
item.description: Compiled in a hilarious series by Bored Panda, these daft pets and wild animals from around the world whose greed got the better of them have ended up in a range of sticky situations.

item.title: What different savings challenges are there and are they any good?
item.description: Many Britons have managed to squirrel away extra cash during lockdown, perhaps saving on commuting costs, going out and memberships they no longer needed.

item.title: Life insurance for over 60s: What are your options?
item.description: Our life insurance policies both mature in 2029 and have no renewal options. A new policy is too expensive - what options do we have?

item.title: Woman leaves thousands speechless with her very organised linen closet
item.description: A photo posted in an Australian Facebook group shows five shelves filled with 24 containers marked with labels like towels, sheets and pillowcases - as well as an entire box dedicated to batteries.

item.title: Drug trials can offer hope but as Wendy's story reveals, the pandemic has even stolen that
item.description: Fighting tears, the nurse explained that a potentially life-saving NHS drug trial Wendy Peake had been due to be enrolled in had been cancelled due to Covid-19. Doctors had said it was her only chance.

item.title: GPs are better at diagnosing cancer if they trust their feelings rather than relying on symptoms
item.description: Doctors are better at diagnosing cancer if they trust their 'gut feeling' rather than relying on official symptoms, a study by Oxford University shows.

item.title: Marcus Rashford seen arriving at Heathrow three days after he was seen with Harry Maguire
item.description: Manchester United star Marcus Rashford has been pictured returning home from his holiday in Mykonos while his club captain Harry Maguire remains on the Greek island following his arrest.
